member.name: T:Breeze.Serialization.DynamicTypeRenamingSerializationBinder
member.summary: Renames the serialized type name of dynamically generated types. Used by Json.Net when populating the $type property in JSON serializated data.
member.remarks:
This class delegates to the Json.Net except when serializing a dynamic type in which case it outputs a simplified version of the dynamic type name and pretends the type belongs to an assembly named "Dynamic".
It cures an objection many people have to the actual CLR name of the dynamic type that is created for objects returned by a projection into an anonymous type.
member.example:
A projection query in John Papa's "Code Camper Jumpstart" sample returns an anonymous type. With the default binder, the serialized name for that type is "_IB_DGU56or_prSk3yzZB87I8gCBWABk[[System.Int32, mscorlib],[System.String, mscorlib],[System.String, mscorlib],[System.Int32, mscorlib],[System.Int32, mscorlib],[System.Int32, mscorlib],[System.Int32, mscorlib],[System.String, mscorlib],[System.String, mscorlib]], _IB_DGU56or_prSk3yzZB87I8gCBWABk_IdeaBlade"
This binder will intercept that type and name it "_IB_DGU56or_prSk3yzZB87I8gCBWABk, Dynamic".
Does the same thing for the anonymous types that a controller could return. For example, the DocCode "Lookups" endpoint creates and returns an anonymous object. This binder will cause the $type to be something like "<>f__AnonymousType6`3, Dynamic".

member.param: language or locale to return the messages in if this parameter is omitted, the first browser language is used

member.name: M:onYOURway.Controllers.LocateController.Realms
member.summary: A realm (e.g. the the onYOURway-Project, 'Karte von morgen', the Green Map System or the TransforMap project) uses different capabilities of the onYOURway-mapping paltform, may have its own taxonomy and covers locations in different regions. The combination of realm, region and creator define how an entry can be administered.

member.name: M:onYOURway.Controllers.LocateController.Regions(System.String)
member.summary: Geographical region (country, city) and administrative domain usually maintained by one realm. E.g. "Bayreuth von morgen"

member.summary: Returns a list of locations including their related properties

member.name: P:onYOURway.Models.Entry.SourceKey
member.summary: When importing data from foreign sources this is a unique key for the import source Recuring imports from the same source should use the same key.
member.remarks: The key may correspond to an external system key but it is not intended to create an external system for every imported spreadsheet.

member.name: T:onYOURway.Models.EntryLink
member.summary: Links to websites, phone numbers email addresses, ...
member.remarks: Do not replicate with systems enforcing this table to be published e.g. ODbL

member.name: P:onYOURway.Models.EntryLink.AccessLevel
member.value: 0 ... do not publish, ues for administrative purpose only
1 ... humans only - try to protect against grabbers, publish in details and via throttled API, do not replicate to external databases
2 ... public - include in bulk results in API, exports and publish to external systems

member.name: P:onYOURway.Models.Category.Key
member.summary: Optional unique string-based id wich might be more intuitive to work with than the internally used UUID's
member.remarks: This key can also be used to corellate to external key/value baed tagging systems like OSM

member.name: P:onYOURway.Models.Category.ValueEditor
member.summary: Select an editor to add an additional value to the category assignment (possibly a percentage of products for organic stores). - null ... no value allowed (the category is assigned or not) - text, textarea, reichtext - array of options e.g. ['green', 'blue', 'red']

member.name: P:onYOURway.Models.Category.ValueOptions

member.summary: Determines if this name is shown when listing categories in the entry details. It can still be used for searching.

member.name: P:onYOURway.Models.CategoryName.Description
member.summary: Description what this ctegory means or how to qualify.
member.remarks: While it is quite easy to tell if a venture is a restaurant, it is not that easy for an organic store.
